thread.title: Victor Cruz doing 'OK' following release from Giants
thread.title_full: Victor Cruz doing 'OK' following release from Giants

author: Kirstie Chiappelli (kchiappelli@sportingnews.com)
title: Victor Cruz doing 'OK' following release from Giants
text:
NFL February 13, 2017 12:58pm   12:58pm EST American Football, News, English, Victor Cruz, NFL, New York Giants The veteran wide receiver had two seasons left on his contract with New York and was set to count $9.4 million against the salary cap. Giants wide receiver Victor Cruz (Getty Images) 
Updated at 12:58 p.m. ET 
Updated at 12:58 p.m. ET 
Victor Cruz's time with the Giants has come to an end. 
According to NFL Network , the veteran wide receiver is doing "OK" after being released Monday in order to save the team $7.5 million in salary cap money. 
MORE: Robert Kraft shrugs off Patriots players skipping White House visit 
Cruz had two seasons left on his contract with the Giants and was set to count $9.4 million against the salary cap in 2017. The team has yet to announce the roster move. 
Cruz, 30, has spent his entire seven-year NFL career in New York after going undrafted out of UMass in 2010. He emerged as a star wideout during the 2011 season by finishing the year with 82 catches for 1,536 yards and nine touchdowns and continued his success on the field in 2012. 
Things took a turn for the worst for Cruz in 2014 when he suffered a torn patellar tendon in his knee and struggled to bounce back. He missed the entire 2015 season after suffering a calf injury while rehabbing his knee and fell into a No. 3 wide receiver role for the Giants this season behind Odell Beckham Jr. and rookie Sterling Shepard, logging just 39 catches for 586 yards and a touchdown. Watch This
